name: iSono Health
headline: AI-powered platform for Accessible and Personalized Breast Healthâ¦
description:
The iSono Health platform combines automated 3D ultrasound technology with cloud computation and artificial intelligence to empower women and their physicians with early detection and monitoring of breast cancer. Our patented compact ultrasound scanner captures 3D images through automatic scanning of whole breast volume in 1 min. The device connects to a smartphone/tablet/laptop and is controlled by our mobile app. The data is transferred to a secure cloud for image processing and storage. Our machine learning algorithm uses acoustic biomarkers to identify abnormal masses.  Our platformâs automated operation and software expands ultrasound use in point-of-care diagnostics as well as monitoring of breast health at home, walk-in and mobile clinics. 

iSono Health offers women and healthcare providers :
Safety: No Radiation
Actionable Feedback with AI
Fast: 2min Scan
Easy to Use

# Say hello to
![atusa_logo_color](https://isonohealth.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/04/atusa_logo_color-e1648821986152.png)
## The world's first AI-driven* portable and automated 3D breast ultrasound scanner
[ Schedule a Free Demo ](http://www.isonohealth.com/<https:/form.typeform.com/to/HaoFNI>)
[ Learn about Pilot Program ](http://www.isonohealth.com/<https:/isonohealth.typeform.com/to/rfF7ag>)
![](https://isonohealth.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/04/Ergo-Hi-rez.2462-e1648824662920.png)
![](https://isonohealth.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/04/FDACLeared-300x150.png)
![Tablet Mockup Front Facing](https://isonohealth.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/04/Tablet-Mockup-Front-Facing-e1649196062349.png)
##### Supported by
![tmc](https://isonohealth.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/04/tmc.png)
![](https://isonohealth.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/04/johnson-and-johnson-1.png)
![nsf 1](https://isonohealth.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/04/nsf-1.png)
![](https://isonohealth.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/04/yc-1.png)
## Automated 3D Ultrasound Scans
ATUSA scanner automatically captures the entire breast volume allowing for repeatable breast ultrasound imaging at point of care without the need for a trained ultrasound operator. With ATUSA’s proprietary scan method, physicians have advanced 3D visualization available at their fingertips to gain confidence in their diagnosis and monitoring of patients.
Consistent Accuracy 
Comprehensive 3D scanning and lesion localization on par with the best ultrasound specialists 
Standardized 
Reproducible whole breast image acquisition and analysis performed consistently across patients. 
![atusa 01](https://isonohealth.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/03/atusa-01.png)
## Unmatched Speed and Convenience
ATUSA’s wearable accessory and intuitive user interface ensure fast, easy and comfortable image acquisition. Scans only take two minute per breast and make breast imaging painless and convenient for patient and practitioner — finally!
Fast 
Fully automated and hands-free scans in 2 minutes, ATUSA is 10-15 times faster than manual probing. 
Operator-agnostic 
Expert results at the point of care without requiring a trained ultrasound operator. 
![](https://isonohealth.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/04/Tablet-Mockup-Front-Facing-e1649196062349-1024x785.png)
## ATUSA Software Suite
ATUSA system is designed from the ground up to seamlessly integrate with AI in this unique hardware and software solution giving the physician a comprehensive set of tools for decision making and patient management
Real-time 2D Image Visualization 
Expert results at the point of care without requiring a trained ultrasound operator. 
Advanced 3D Visualization and Localization Interactive whole breast visualization and lesion localization in radial, coronal, sagittal, and transverse views. 
## Personalized Risk-based Imaging
ATUSA's accessible ultrasound scanning opens the door to personalized longitudinal monitoring for high-risk individuals, providing increased access to care, better patient experience, peace of mind and confidence.
Personalized 
Accessible regular monitoring for high-risk individuals. 
Remote Monitoring 
Personalized longitudinal monitoring, change tracking and remote care made accessible. 
![medicine, healthcare, technology and people concept - doctor with tablet pc computer and woman patient meeting at hospital](https://isonohealth.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/04/doctor-01.jpg)
Consistent Accuracy 
Fully automated, hands-free, 3D scan of whole breast volume 
Standardized 
Reproducible whole breast image acquisition consistently across patients. 
Fast 
Whole breast scans in just 2 minutes, ATUSA is 10-15 times faster than manual probing. 
Operator-agnostic
Expert results at the point of care without requiring a trained ultrasound operator. 
![](https://isonohealth.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/10/ATUSA-26JAN2021.2373-1024x804.png)
Advanced 3D Visualization and Localization 
Interactive 3D whole breast visualization and lesion localization in radial, coronal, sagittal, and transverse views. 
Real-time 2D Image Visualization 
Intuitive real time 2D image acquisition at point of care without requiring ultrasound technologist. 
Personalized 
Accessible regular monitoring for high-risk individuals. 
Remote Monitoring 
Cloud-based remote access to images enables tracking and remote care. 
## Developed by Domain Experts
![](https://isonohealth.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/11/neda_headshot-1.jpg)
Neda Razavi, MBA
CEO
[ Linkedin ](http://www.isonohealth.com/<https:/www.linkedin.com/in/nedarazavi/>) [ Twitter ](http://www.isonohealth.com/<https:/x.com/nedarazavi2?s=20>)
![](https://isonohealth.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/03/shadijpg-altshadi.jpeg)
Shadi Saberi, PhD
Founder, CTO
[ Linkedin ](http://www.isonohealth.com/<https:/www.linkedin.com/in/ssaberig/>)
![](https://isonohealth.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/04/Andrew.jpeg)
Andrew Leynes, PhD
Dir. of Machine Learning 
[ Linkedin ](http://www.isonohealth.com/<https:/www.linkedin.com/in/andrew-leynes-phd-1696aa80/>)
[ Meet the Team ](http://www.isonohealth.com/<https:/isonohealth.com/team/>)
## “ATUSA provides a window into the activity of cancer”
As a son of a breast cancer victim, I can’t emphasize enough the importance of more available and frequent breast cancer screening and monitoring. My mother suffered from the unfortunate consequence of believing she was in remission when her breast cancer returned unbeknownst to her. ATUSA provides a window into the activity of cancer, and, more importantly, builds from this a cancer profile previously unknown to physicians and patients alike.
![Testimonial author](https://isonohealth.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/03/lance.jpg)
Lance M. Black, MD, MBID
TMC Innovation Institute
## Frequently Asked Questions
Who is the ATUSA System designed for?
Initially, the ATUSA system is aimed at physicians offices and women’s health clinics to allow for fast and convenient whole breast imaging at the point of care. The ATUSA system is fully automated, easy to operate and is meant to be used by physicians, nurses, and medical assistants.
What are the components of the ATUSA system?
The ATUSA system is made up of a 3D ultrasound scanner, a wearable accessory, a Windows application (desktop and tablet, Windows 7 and higher) for real-time image display, review and measurement and a secure web application for remote viewing with advanced 3D visualization
How does the ATUSA system work?
First, the patient attaches the wearable accessory and lies on her back. The operator then adjusts the breast tissue, applies coupling medium and attaches the 3D scanner. When the scanner is ready, it can be started from the ATUSA software with the press of a button to automatically image the whole breast volume, which takes approximately two minutes. This procedure can then be repeated on the patient’s other breast.
Where can I try and/or purchase the ATUSA system?
Physicians, women’s health clinics and other relevant health care professionals can get access to the device by registering for a [free demo](http://www.isonohealth.com/<https:/isonohealth.typeform.com/to/HaoFNI>) or registering their interest to [participate in the ATUSA pilot program](http://www.isonohealth.com/<https:/isonohealth.typeform.com/to/rfF7ag>). The ATUSA system is currently only available for investigational use and is not yet available for sale.
What kind of training is required to use ATUSA?
The ATUSA system does not require a radiologist or ultrasound technologist for image acquisition. ATUSA comes with comprehensive instructional videos for system operation and an initial live demo/training session. However, interpretation of images requires a physician with training in breast ultrasound.
How does the ATUSA scanner connect to my tablet or laptop? Is internet connectivity required to use the System?
The ATUSA system connects to your tablet or laptop via USB and does not require an internet connection. Acquired images are saved locally on your device and are automatically backed up to a HIPAA-compliant secure cloud storage when connected to the internet.
###### Regulatory
##### FDA 510(k) Cleared
_The ATUSA system has received FDA 510(k) clearance._
_*AI features described in this website are in the research phase of development and have not been demonstrated safe or effective for clinical use.__Any use of these features and the associated information is for investigational use only and not for diagnostic, therapeutic or other clinical purposes._

generated_description:
**iSono Health: Revolutionizing Breast Health with AI**

Founded in 2016 and a graduate of Y Combinator's W16 batch, iSono Health is based in San Francisco and specializes in transforming breast health diagnostics. At its core, the company is driven by a clear mission: to make breast health more accessible and personalized through an innovative, AI-powered platform.

**The Technology:**  

iSono Health has developed the ATUSA, the world’s first automated 3D breast ultrasound scanner. This device captures entire breast volumes in just two minutes, eliminating the need for trained operators. It works by integrating an automated scanning mechanism with cloud computing and machine learning algorithms to identify abnormal masses using acoustic biomarkers. The compact scanner connects seamlessly to smartphones, tablets, or laptops, with all data securely stored in the cloud for processing.

**Key Benefits:** 

1. **Safety First:** There’s no radiation involved with the ATUSA system, making it a safer option compared to traditional imaging methods.
   
2. **Speed and Convenience:** The scans take only two minutes, making it ten to fifteen times faster than manual methods. This rapid processing means women can undergo screenings with minimal disruption.
  
3. **User-Friendly:** Designed to be operated by healthcare providers at the point of care, the ATUSA system is intuitive enough that it can be utilized even by nurses or medical assistants without extensive training.

4. **AI-Driven Insights:** By leveraging AI, iSono Health provides actionable feedback to both patients and their healthcare providers, enabling early detection and continuous monitoring of breast health.

**The Team:**  

iSono Health is driven by a dedicated team of nine employees, including CEO Neda Razavi and Founder/CTO Shadi Saberi. With a strong technical background, they’re committed to improving breast health care accessibility. Their goal is to provide high-risk individuals with regular, personalized monitoring, enhancing patient experience while ensuring peace of mind.

**Market Position and Future:**  

With a growing emphasis on personalized healthcare, iSono Health is positioned well within the consumer health services and medical device sectors. Supported by key partnerships and innovations, they aim to scale their impact—making breast health screenings and monitoring not just a medical necessity but a simple and routine part of healthcare.

For more information or to request a demo, visit their website at [iSono Health](http://www.isonohealth.com).
